data.title: VS Code do not show side bar after press hotkey(ctrl+shift+F，G or E).
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:33:15.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-theme-onedark|akamud|1.3.1|
|vscode-markdownlint|DavidAnson|0.6.2|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.5|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.9|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.7.0|
|vscode-clang|mitaki28|0.2.2|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.2|
|material-icon-theme|PKief|1.3.4|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.3.0|
|vscode-hexdump|slevesque|1.2.0|
|ayu|teabyii|0.2.1|
|gitblame|waderyan|1.3.0|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|2.1.7|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Hide the side bar, and then set focus on edit area.
2.press ctrl+shift+(F G or E) 
3.VS Code won't show sider bar.

Expecedt Behavior:
If side bar is hide, VS code should show it first when user press those hotkey.

1. open a workspace
2. open debug viewlet
3. click on "Add Configuration" from the dropdown:

data.title: Use Gulp To Generate Markdown Langauge Includes
data.body:
**Bug**
The markdown grammar for fenced code blocks is rather unmaintainable since it involves lots of copy and pasted code

**Fix**
Use a gulp task and a template to generate the fenced code block grammar includes. This allows adding new languages more easily and will help keep the fenced code block definitions in sync

data.title: Drag&Drop from Open File Dialog causes VS Code to Freeze

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:33:15.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15048
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.6.2|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click "File"->"Open File..." 
2. Find some file to open
3. Instead of clicking "Open" in the Open File Dialog, drag the file into the main window.
4. Close the Open File Dialog without selecting a file

Expected:
Can continue to use VS Code as usual.
Actual:
VS Code shows the "edit text" mouse cursor and is no longer interactive. I typically have to kill the process to resume.

data.title: VSCode generates wrong ${command.pickProcess} for .NET Core project
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version:
 OS Name:     Mac OS X
 OS Version:  10.11
 OS Platform: Darwin
 RID:         osx.10.11-x64
Steps to Reproduce:
1. create a .net core project by running the command `dotnet new console`
2. In `Show Debug` window, click `Add Configuration...`, in the drop-down list select `.NET Core`
3. In the newly generated `launch.json` file, check `"processId": "${command.pickProcess}"` which should be `"processId": "${command:pickProcess}"`

data.title: Add Specific No Result Found Messages for Implementations and Type Definition
data.body:
fixes #21683

Adds specific messages when `go to implementation` or `go to type definition` returns no results

data.title: Feature Request: Ability to synchronize settings between multiple machines/operating systems via Microsoft account.
data.body:
I use VSCode on my MacBook and my Windows 10 machine. I often change settings on one machine and then forget to make the same changes on the other machine. Semi-regularly I have to copy the settings file from one machine to the other to keep them in sync. This is made a little more difficult if I've made changes on both machines.

I know I can work around this with a git repository or other external solutions but it would be cool if we were able to sign into our Microsoft account from within VSCode and choose to sync editor settings to the cloud.

data.title: Differently encoded files show modified decoration
data.body:
- Get a encoded as UTF-16 or some other non-UTF-8 encoding, like 
[utf-16-big-endian.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/822645/utf-16-big-endian.txt)
- Initialize a git repo with that file, commit it
- Open the file
- The whole thing shows the blue modified indicator on the side:

data.title: [php] syntax highlighter issue with SQL
data.body:
The PHP syntax highlighter seems to have a bug. It attempts to syntax highlight SQL code within PHP strings, but if there is a SQL comment on the last line of the string, the highlighter gets confused...
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8480646/23629003/424967f2-0284-11e7-8944-0c04bc2bf0a5.png)

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a php file.
2. Add the following code...
```
        $sql = "SELECT value1
                FROM table_name t
                WHERE t.column1 = 3
                  --AND t.column2 = 'value';"
```

data.title: Output console error catch (feature)
data.body:
Hello there, will be nice to have an error handler from output console; I mean, if I want to compile a file with gcc/g++ or make (from task.json) and during compilation there are some errors, will be great to (Ctrl +) click on the error showed on output console of Visual Studio Code and to be redirected to specified file at specified line number and column number (like in Eclipse).

The format error string showed on the output console is like (in python it is almost the same) :
fileName:line number:column number: error: description error

Just an error example:
file.cpp:630:6: error: expected '}' before 'else'

What do you think? I think this feature can improve a lot the productivity.

Cheers
Paolo

data.title: "suppressTaskName" incoherence when running multiple commands in task.json

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
VSCode Version: 1.10.x
OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

'suppressTaskName' is true by default when running multiple commands and it is not possible to change this setting

**Current Behavior**:
		If suppressTaskName is true(default), the command line is **node arg1** (Right)
    		If suppressTaskName is false, it is **node arg1** (Wrong)	 

**Expected Behavior**:
    		If suppressTaskName is true, the command line is **node arg1** 
    		If suppressTaskName is false, it is **node task1 arg1**

The issue exists in both version 0.1.0 and 2.0.0

I also consider incoherent to have 'suppressTaskName' set to true or false as default regarding you are running multiple or single command 

Example:
**multiple Command** 
'suppressTaskName' is set to true as default and it is not possible to change this behavior
The command line is **node arg1**
```
{
"version": "0.1.0",
"tasks": [ 
        {
            "taskName": "task1",
            "isShellCommand": true,
            "command": "node",
            "suppressTaskName": false,
            "args": [
		arg1
            ]
        },
        {
       "taskName": "task2",
            "command": "gulp",
            "args": [
		arg1
            ]
        }
```


**Single Command**
'suppressTaskName' is set to false as default 
The command line is **node task1 arg1**
```
{
     "version": "0.1.0",
     "command": "node",
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "task1",
            "isShellCommand": true,
            "args": [
                  arg1
            ]
        },
        {
            "taskName": "task2",
            "isShellCommand": true,
            "args": [
                  arg1
            ]
        }
]
}
```

data.title: Investigate to provide guidance for technology stacks
Separate 'configuration' from 'learning' quick links
[scss] when completing functions place cursor between brackets
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.11.0-insider (a3b1076f079c150d921a7b91d91c6783fa04450a, 2017-03-06T07:04:45.166Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.5.1|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.2.0|
|html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.0.3|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.12.0|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.13.3|
|nord-visual-studio-code|arcticicestudio|0.1.1|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.7|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.9|
|tslint|eg2|0.8.1|
|copy-relative-path|enochc|0.1.1|
|Angular2|johnpapa|2.0.3|
|vscode-icon-theme|jtlowe|1.5.0|
|theme-karyfoundation-themes|karyfoundation|11.0.0|
|restructuredtext|lextudio|0.0.21|
|HTMLHint|mkaufman|0.3.3|
|vscode-autoprefixer|mrmlnc|2.0.0|
|vscode-csscomb|mrmlnc|4.0.1|
|vscode-stylefmt|mrmlnc|2.2.3|
|stylelint|shinnn|0.23.0|
|darcula-extended|smlombardi|3.3.2|
|slime|smlombardi|1.2.0|
|theme-tesla|smlombardi|6.0.0|
|vscode-todo-highlight|wayou|0.4.5|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|;


---

Probably affects CSS as well.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type a scss function, such as `transform: scaleX()`, allowing Intellisense to complete the `scaleX` part for you
2. the cursor/insertion point is placed *after* the parens instead of between them.  This means to type a value, you need to place the cursor inside the parens manually.  See gif:

![mar-06-2017 12-46-44](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/835148/23622014/fb04493e-026a-11e7-9431-450e8ae34404.gif)

data.title: Copy with formatting enhancement
data.body:
We've received quite a lot feature/enhancement requests, including but not limited to


- [x] Wrong formatting when pasting to Word https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21584

Defer:
- Copy With Syntax Highlighting not work with Keynote/Pages https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21686 . We are bound to Browser so there is nothing we can do in current design. To fix this issue, we need to have a way to communicate with system clipboard natively.
- Option to disable copy with formatting https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21820 . It's easy to implement but we are looking for more 👍

data.title: Drag and drop enhancement
data.body:
- [x] Copy content when pressing Ctrl and drag-and-drop https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21978 https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21145
- [x] D&D affordance https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21158
- [x] D&D Mouse Pointer Styles

data.title: Move lines honor indentation rules
data.body: It can be part of https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4039 but more doable. While implementing this feature, I'll add a new config and that can be extended further for auto indents.

data.title: Move to XLIFF format for string localizations
data.body: Currently VS Code uses internal Microsoft format to enable localisation. This to needs be replaced by XLIFF to facilitate #22070 for open community translations as well as to move away from proprietary format.

data.title: Launching shared process is slow
data.body: We receive cpu profiles that show spawning the shared process being very slow in some cases.

data.title: readFromDomElement sometimes slow
data.body: We receive profiles that show `_readFromDomElement` being very slow in some cases. This is the umbrella item which point to the profiles.
